This year, we went to Shoreline Lake to view the Moutain View the independent day fireworks.
It is the first firework year after COVID. We are so close to the fireworks.
It is not a good experience to having the car park in the parking lot. Very difficult to go in and come out.
Never come near the “concert” and park the car in the parking lot.
Fireworks in Moutain View At 9:45, the sky was almost dark, and the lights were off.
Closest to the fireworks Since we went to the east side of the lake, we stopped at a place where people are gathered. We “guess"ed this would be a good place for watching the fireworks.
Indeed, this is the closet place to the fireworks. It looks like the fireworks shooters were just in front of us. This is the best reason why people are all here.
The sound is a little big but not so bad.
Back This is a picture when we walk back to the parking lot.
Eventually, we got out and on the high way at around 10:38 pm.
Other options Great American Fireworks Santa Clara Library

posts.content:
Today is my 2nd time volunteer experience at AAH (https://www.animalassistedhappiness.org/).
Other than school volunteer, I have less experience on other organizations. AAH is providing the oportunities with the animals. I like close to the animals.
Clean the Horse House We already know the process:
Pick and clean up the horse manure Pile the leaves under the tree Fill the water Check and fill the big holes Pick and dump the branches This time, we have 5 people total.
I thought we only need 1 hour, actual we spent one and a half hours.
Me and my kid My kid starts to take more resposibility of the volunteer work since last time, we were doing the same chores.
This time, my kid looks confident. My kid knows what to do and how to do. And we also checked with the Farm Manager that we should pick the tree branches.
I was trying to leave some work to my kid and let her go and communicate with others. We are together with 2 students, and the mother of one student.
She did a good job, first I feel she can handle the work and follow the Farm Manager’s instructions, of course we did one time before. And after almost all work is done, I asked her to talk to manager about our progress.
I did not capture that moment with photos, but I feel she is quite ready to talk to anyone who is more senior than her.
After talking to the manager, she asked me if she could go and carry the tank to pick up the tree branches. She did all by herself, including find a helper, pick up the keys for the dump area, carray the stuff and go.
My kid like to use the tool, when we carry some dirt from Bone Yard to the horse field, actually it is a little heavy for her. But she insist on doing it and when a elder student is trying to take away her oportunity to use the tool.
Eventually, it is really heavy. Three of us carried the “hand tipper”. I am not quite sure how to call that.
Visit favorite animal site Once the horse cleaning is done, we goes to rabbit and guinea pig area to pet these small animals.
After pet the Guinea pig, which is the most popular place after the fram chores. We are back home.

posts.content:
In IC (Integrated Circuit) industry, CAD is a function to make hardware designer’s life easy. This is how I define CAD in hardware design. “Easy” contains different meanings.
Easy to understand the inputs Easy to use the functions Easy to check the result (Accurate and reliable) A lot of people always like to use Apple products as an example. Here I am.
Apple has suitable technologies but not the most advanced technology.
The most advanced technology means more risk. But to put the superior technology which is best fit the customer is the key to success.
BUT, the best solution is always the one that fits the scenario best no matter it follows the following principles or not.
CAD Framework is designed for the professional All the hardware designers are experts in the industry. When I first joined the CAD group, I was thinking about how to help and what can I help the professionals.
I need to find out my value to the CAD utility users, to our professional hardware designers since I am not better than them in terms of making chips.
Since the customers of VLSI CAD utilities are professional hardware engineers, the goal of CAD utilities is to develop a set of tools that can help with accuracy, productivity.
Easy to get the data Easy to send the data Easy to use the data In a big organization, easy also means standardization.
Good practice 1: Least Astonishment a.k.a. least surprise
Configuration is always a good example to explain this rule.
In CAD utility, we may have multiple ways to configure the operations.
Some of them are from environmental variables Some of them are from the configuration file, like (yaml, json) Some of them are from project hook, defaults, etc. Some of them are from handover criteria Some of them are from the EDA tool itself Sometimes we can not avoid introducing confusion. Then the problem becomes how to resolve the issue, clear the confusion.
Single Source of True (SSoT) And in our configuration file, we may have an if-else statement to switch based on the conditions.
If the learning curve is so steep, it is not suitable for new projects. They will refuse to migrate.
Even the engineers master the utility once, they will learn again in the next project.
The ideal case is that, in our platform, all the utilities can read the configuration from one source.
But this is not practical. The hardware design is not AI-ready yet. We still need to handle a lot of cases during daily engineering work.
So the solution is that we can split the function or modularize the function layer by layer. Each layer, we have the APIs, or we call configuration files, for inputs and outputs.
The inputs and outputs are well defined in one entry file. The file is called “Metadata”, and the APIs should consistently deliver with “Metadata”, no guessing.
{ "metadata" : { "name" : "flow_config", "user": "icsteve", "$rel": { "connect" : "connect_api_1" } }, "dataset" : { "width" : 100, "height" : 100 } } In the real scenario, we can have more constraints. Like, the dataset must be the objects, k-v pairs.
Instead of understanding this rule as a single file, we bring the metadata concept, which represents the “Single Source”.
And in metadata, we also need to describe the relationship between each metadata key. This could be part of the metadata as well.
The relationship ($rel) is the logic for certain business needs, so it requires product SPEC to describe how to use and explain the relations.
Unambiguous The “unambiguous” is always talked about when writing a requirement/schema or configuration.
Some configuration is good to use on|off or 1|0, then we should keep it simple.
Sometimes 1 or 0 is no telling what is going to do, so we might need to use the word precisely.
When defining schema or design configuration, it is better to send it out to different people for review. If any questions come into your email box, that means the setting is not clear enough what will happen.
Conventions vs Configuration I prefer explicit configuration, not conventions.
But the conventions (default naming) can make the configuration pretty simple.
Good practice 2: Guide instead of Blaming When users are asking usage questions, or they abuse some options.
Did you just reply: “Please read the document!!!”
No! No!! No!!!
Most users are experienced users using the EDA (Electronic Design Automation) tools.
If the user is not clear, that means The philosophy of current utility design is terrible!
I always suggest the new CAD comers participate in several project tapeout. Then we can get the real scenario our customers are facing.
Of course, Software and hardware share the same ground. But still, there are some DDD (domain-driven design) differences.
Examples and Templates Provide enough templates and examples to bring the users in as quickly as possible.
The template is essential. Users are able to start with the templates (recipes), which are tested by the CAD developers.
To educate the user, what should we do?
HowTo Develop a training material to help users to build knowledge.
WhatNext When an error happened, try to give out:
What happened, error message, error code, etc. Error code location, highlight if possible Give out the suggestion, whatnext Dryrun We have thousands of configuration items, it is not easy to remember all of them.
So to review the settings which will apply to the upcoming run is essential, helping the users to check and identify the potential issues.
This is called the ability of “dry-run”.
Dry-run log is another art of work that could be very useful.
Help System The help system is not only about documents and training.
The document could be in code (show during logging and runtime)
You could have a 100-page word/pdf document, but think about how do the users use the document.
The help system also includes -h / --help, man page, error handling, variable tracing, etc.
The help system is a big topic. We will talk about it next week Help System.
Good practice 3: Keep it Simple, Stupid Decouple, more is less We have some cases that we need to re-use some utility or code, and then modularization is a good approach.
Think about this case, the library is used everywhere, and one day there is a bug introduced which causes the whole system down.
Of course, we have other ways to roll back. And reusability is really required in our scenario.
What if I control the revision, and for each module, it is checked out separately. Then even I want to update the common utility for a specific application, it will not affect others.
Functional Options The argument or option should not be hard to understand and should not be too many.
If there are many arguments needed, the utility may need to consider use input configuration files as well.
Visualization CLI is needed for the first place, but GUI or Visualization is also great to have.
That means web technology is a good skill to gain in the CAD career.

In the “Project Management” Course, one of the topics is “Communication Plan”.
When the phrase “communication plan” is used, I feel it is pretty clear what should I do to sell the product and have better connection with the users, and among the developers.
Communication plans can help you clarify the purpose of a product launch or new initiative and officially determine the messages you want to deliver to your intended audience(s).
During my CAD daily work, the important part is to talk to the users, support them.
Weekly meetings Feedback collecting Documentation etc. Some of them are driven by the users, and some of them are driven by the product team. I never think about I can group them and call all these activities “Communication Plan”.
Prepare the “Communication Plan” When preparing the plan, always ask ourselves these questions.
Why do you want to communicate with the community? (What’s your purpose?) To whom do you want to communicate it? (Who’s your audience?) What do you want to communicate? (What’s your message?) How do you want to communicate it? (What communication channels will you use?) Whom should you contact, and what should you do to use those channels? (How will you distribute your message?) Once these questions get answered, we have a better picture for the CAD product communication.
First, during the project implementation, project manager needs to communicate with the developers to make sure the project is on track. Like check the milestone, enable the collabration, resolve the issues, etc.
Second, after involving the key users, collect the feedback, understand the usage difficulty of new CAD product.
Third, think about the documentation, not only for the end-users, but also for the development community.
Last but not the least, talk to upper management for the upcomming new product or followup revision of current product.
Convert “Communication Plan” to a document and share Like all other plans in the project, “Communication Plan” needs to be clearly documented, and transparent to the project members and users.
Here is a table for us to easily go through the key items one by one and then put into the document.
Description Frequency Channel Audience Owner Status Kick off meeting One time Zoom + Meeting-Room All internal stakeholders and project team members Project Manager@PM Planned Status updates Weekly Zoom + Meeting-Room All project team members Project Manager@PM Planned Milestone and deliverable updates Monthly Zoom All project team members, stakeholders optional Project Manager@PM Planned Project stand-up (check-in) Daily Slack Project team Project Team Planned Weekly User Synch-up Weekly Zoom + Meeting-Room Customers and project team Customers and Project Team Planned Use QR code to generate calendar Here is one of the online utility to generate the QR code image which can help to be added into the mobile calendar.
QRickit for calendar generation
Use iphone to scan the code:
Use python to generate ics files The goal for the python script is to generate different kinds of meeting place holders for a project.
Kick off meeting Weekly meeting to track the project status Milestone Review meetings Meetings to resolve the conflicts and issues Project closing meeting To test the following function
# Install iCalendar pip install icalendar # Run the function python create_ics.py # Test example.ics # Double click example.ics #!env python3 from icalendar import Calendar, Event, vCalAddress, vText import pytz from datetime import datetime import os from pathlib import Path # Creating icalendar/event event = Event() event.add('summary', 'Python meeting about calendaring') event.add('dtstart', datetime(2021, 1, 12, 8, 0, 0, tzinfo=pytz.utc)) event.add('dtend', datetime(2021, 1, 12, 10, 0, 0, tzinfo=pytz.utc)) event.add('dtstamp', datetime(2021, 1, 12, 0, 10, 0, tzinfo=pytz.utc)) # Adding Organizer organizer = vCalAddress('MAILTO:organizer@example.com') organizer.params['cn'] = vText('Organizer') organizer.params['role'] = vText('CHAIR') event['organizer'] = organizer # Adding attendee attendee = vCalAddress('MAILTO:foobar@example.com') attendee.params['cn'] = vText('Foo Bar') attendee.params['ROLE'] = vText('REQ-PARTICIPANT') event.add('attendee', attendee, encode=0) # Adding location event['location'] = vText('Zoom Link') # Adding events to calendar cal = Calendar() cal.add_component(event) directory = str(Path(__file__).parent.parent) + "/" # print(directory) f = open(os.path.join(directory, 'example.ics'), 'wb') f.write(cal.to_ical()) f.close() # vim: ft=python

posts.content:
As a project manager, one very important task is to learn, understand, broadcast the project goal correctly and efficiently. This must be documented and put a place, so that project manager can go through it in the meeting and the team can refer to the document any time.
The solution could be dropbox, sharepoint, onenote, git, ftp, etc.
Goal of “tcl-csh-cli” Let’s look at the goal of “tcl-csh-cli” project.
Major Goal Create a framework using tcl and csh to handle the complex design requirement. Milestones Create csh cli interface with Tcl (Phase 1) in Dec. 2021 To enable the development of tcl To enable the test friendly concept The framework concept, like hotfix, portability, etc. Implement tcl function and connect with csh (Phase 1) in Jan. 2022 The tcl function must be for VLSI design consume. The framework concept, like plugin, hotfix, portability, etc. To enable the test friendly concept Create csh cli interface with Tcl (Phase 2) in Feb. 2022 More details, like interuption handling, extension (plugin), etc. Implement tcl function and connect with csh (Phase 2) in Mar. 2022 More details, like interuption handling, extension (plugin), etc. Document and Training during the whole project. Writing the training material Some details Source code version control, using github. Put all the document in the docs folder of git repository. Recap It is important to share the main goal with all the team members and make sure we have the same target.
And also it is important to define the milestones, we may need to adjust in the future, but make sure we have a plan when we start the project.

posts.content:
This is a project used to demostrate the project management process and also it is my first project which could benefit the IC design community.
I will build a course to finish this project through several months. And the project name is “Build Cli with tcl and csh”.
The project will be split to several sections in a course to tell some key technology stuff and program management skills.
Project Initialzation First question, how does this project come out?
Usually, for an application, we have Graphic User Interface and Command User Interface.
In EDA industry, tcl is still a very important glue language. I wrote a post to share some thought why tcl is a fit choice for EDA industry.
Nowdays, python is more and more popular, and to use python as the main interface language is possible, but not just one or two years task.
Tcl is still the major language for VLSI industry.
Intention Tcl is very flexible, and too flexible to error out. We need a framework to constrain certain use model. This is the initiative of “tcl-csh-cli” project.
Prepare the kick-off meeting Check if the meeting is intended to involve all the developers or just some key stakeholders and developers. Make sure you can get more good support in the meeting. (pre-kickoff talk with people) Make a decision, what collabration tool will be used, like Jira, Asana, Focalboard, etc. Draft the schedule and milestone Kick-Off meeting minutes Date: 11/24/2021 Attendees: Steve, Jane, Peter Topic: “tcl-csh-cli” kick-off meeting Will this project be alive for long term? Maybe not, this is more like a demostrate project, we can keep maintaining it if we find a good path. And usually, there are a lot of commercial solutions. Resource planning: I will create several virtual roles to tell some development stories and also show case how different teams or different poeple work with each other. Do we need GUI? Yes, we need, but must be built on top of CLI and the priority is low. What is the cost and profit? Time is the main costs for this project, and profit is to make friends, and earn money for support and plugin sale. Define deliveries: A framework for developers to develop the flows. Schedule and Milestone: The entire project is splited to three phases, one is the basic feature, and other two are advanced feature. Collect user feedbacks: Reserve some meetings to collect user’s feedback. Technical Related Source Code is hosted at https://github.com/xoit/tcl-csh-cli tclsh expert Jane csh expert Peter Git usage training Some developers are not familiar with git User requirement document User feedback document Technology SPEC

In this post, I would like to talk about my view on technology selection.
When we talk about VLSI CAD (not EDA), most people will think about CS background, coding ability, etc.
But I want to think out of box, as a project manager, I can not just pick option 1 or option 2. It is always good to use SME (Subject Matter Expert) tool. So we may need to group a team with option 1 and option 2 mixture.
Option 1: Gather a group of software developers Option 2: Have the domain experts, ASIC design experts My option is that, it is better to have some domain specific knowledge before doing software development. Like if we don’t know the area of our client who is in finacial industry, maybe it is not easy to communicate and maybe the software is good but more like a generic one, not designed for our customer.
What to choose for main program language After doing some research,
python tcl csh perl bash csh is not good comparing to other shell language. But since this is the default shell by our OS, and a lot of application is already built on top of csh.

posts.content:
Recently, I enrolled the Project Management course in Coursera. The course is delivered by Google.
I found this is interesting, because usually we have some basic knowledge how to manage a small team, and how to manage a simple project.
For example, plan a trip, upgrade the gararge, etc.
After going through the first course, I found this course can really help to correct my mindset and change the way how to communicate with other people.
Is project management necessary? Till last year, I am in charge of the release, I realize that project management is really important. A project really needs a good plan and also after the major work is done, doing some follow-ups, etc.
We have a release happening every several months. First several releases is OK since we have less customers, and did not get a lot of support. So the Google’s online course “Foundations of Project Management” introduces what is project management, what is project manager, and what is the role of project managers in different organziations.
Some of the senior manages in my organization will play the role of project managers, plan the project, communicate with teams and stakeholders.
As I was promoted to a new role, I was starting to manage some tasks and keep eys on them.
Course Note “Foundations of Project Management” After finish the Course one, I have questions to ask myself.
What is the projet managers’ role in my team If our team will hire a project manager, how these skills which are discussed in the course can help our team. Basically, before the task is assigned to the team member, we can have project manager initialize the project and track the progress of the project.
Our work is providing service to other teams, and the commitment is very important. So to have a project manager will be helpful. Actually we have several program managers, but they just focus on something more high level.
What if I am the project manager If I am a project manager, I would like to show my impact and make the project.
How to make my personal skill more professional Most people already have some project management skill or the sense how to manage a project.
Just these skills sometimes is a personal ability, there are better ways we can learn and tune our personal skill to be the professional ability.
Project management lifecycle and methodologies Split project into different phases Closing project is important Agile Waterfall Lean and Six Sigma As a lead or manager, tool is necessary.
master Excel Email Writing Todo list Issue tracking tool, like Jira Graph basis to express data Python AHK etc.

Another reason to learn Tcl A motivation to learn tcl: Many scripting languages support tk GUI programming, so by learning tcl/tk, you learn a GUI language, plus tcl is almost the most important Interface language for IC. ### 3. Copyright awareness I see a lot of good sharing, but every time I see something, my first question is really, can this be used to spread? As my own notes may not be a problem, I gave up some expertise on the entry point to share, and instead share general knowledge, I see many articles to share is no problem, but need to pay attention to: how you protect the intellectual property rights of others today, tomorrow others will also respect your intellectual property rights. ### 4. CAD skill tree - PDK CAD skill tree: master the structure of the PDK and the role of each file, and be familiar with how to use each file. As a CAD engineer, you are often dealing with data, one of which is the PDK provided by foundry, called Process Design Kit, which is a modeling of a specific semiconductor manufacturing process, using the model provided in the PDK, together with the purchased EDA, you can design the chip, including but not limited to: technology file, design rule, spice... CAD skill tree: master the structure of PDK and the role of each file, and be familiar with how to use each file. ### 5. Timing Uncertainty (1 & 2) Q: What is the purpose of setting timing uncertainty in chip design constraints? How do I set it? Answer: When I first came into contact with constraints, I was doing Logical Synthesis and STA, at that time it was still 65nm, the constraints were not that complicated, and the experience value was good. After more and more exposure, from STA, APR to CAD, my thoughts are changing. As an overview, uncertainty setting, as the name suggests, is used to cover the entire process of uncertainty, different stages need to consider different uncertainty, generally for the downstream work to reserve the timing space. We are going to give examples from back to front, first STA timing signoff settings from the foundry process uncertainty, generally process manufacturers for the process line to do debugging, such as ocv. also include different products back to some of the experience of the actual test, the product on the yield, DFT test, work environment, aging and a series of product itself The product's own considerations. Of course, STA has many other factors that may affect the uncertainty setting, such as the accuracy of STA, PBA vs GBA, the margin reserved for SI or transition, etc. The next step is Routing, the more the previous step requires a certainty that includes the value of the subsequent steps plus some of the issues that need to be considered in this step, the routing uncertainty mainly covers the gap between global routing and real routing. EDA tools are constantly improving the accuracy of virtual routing and narrowing the gap between it and real routing. Specifically on more (not considering detour or congestion and other issues triggered by the large delay), to give an example of a little off, due to routing after the impact on the path delay more virtual will have longer or shorter, plus ocv, this value in several iteration can be estimated out, one of the empirical values. Knowledge is a treasure but practice is the key

tree command is helping to show the structure of folders and files.
Real Case When discussing the folder structure via video meeting, express the structure is a little bit challenge if we have a lot of levels and files. How to make the folder and file structure clear when we present something?
. means in current dir. and we can use pwd to replace it.
➜ tree -a --dirsfirst . ├── test -> test_3 ├── test_1 │ └── file_1 ├── test_2 │ └── file_2 ├── test_3 │ └── file_3 └── .conf 4 directories, 4 files ➜ tree `pwd` -a --dirsfirst /Users/steve/demo ├── test -> test_3 ├── test_1 │ └── file_1 ├── test_2 │ └── file_2 ├── test_3 │ └── file_3 └── .conf 4 directories, 4 files Understand Let’s first see the tree command help:
➜ ~ tree --help usage: tree [-acdfghilnpqrstuvxACDFJQNSUX] [-H baseHREF] [-T title ] [-L level [-R]] [-P pattern] [-I pattern] [-o filename] [--version] [--help] [--inodes] [--device] [--noreport] [--nolinks] [--dirsfirst] [--charset charset] [--filelimit[=]#] [--si] [--timefmt[=]<f>] [--sort[=]<name>] [--matchdirs] [--ignore-case] [--fromfile] [--] [<directory list>] ------- Listing options ------- -a All files are listed. -d List directories only. -l Follow symbolic links like directories. -f Print the full path prefix for each file. -x Stay on current filesystem only. -L level Descend only level directories deep. -R Rerun tree when max dir level reached. -P pattern List only those files that match the pattern given. -I pattern Do not list files that match the given pattern. --ignore-case Ignore case when pattern matching. --matchdirs Include directory names in -P pattern matching. --noreport Turn off file/directory count at end of tree listing. --charset X Use charset X for terminal/HTML and indentation line output. --filelimit # Do not descend dirs with more than # files in them. --timefmt <f> Print and format time according to the format <f>. -o filename Output to file instead of stdout. ------- File options ------- -q Print non-printable characters as '?'. -N Print non-printable characters as is. -Q Quote filenames with double quotes. -p Print the protections for each file. -u Displays file owner or UID number. -g Displays file group owner or GID number. -s Print the size in bytes of each file. -h Print the size in a more human readable way. --si Like -h, but use in SI units (powers of 1000). -D Print the date of last modification or (-c) status change. -F Appends '/', '=', '*', '@', '|' or '>' as per ls -F. --inodes Print inode number of each file. --device Print device ID number to which each file belongs. ------- Sorting options ------- -v Sort files alphanumerically by version. -t Sort files by last modification time. -c Sort files by last status change time. -U Leave files unsorted. -r Reverse the order of the sort. --dirsfirst List directories before files (-U disables). --sort X Select sort: name,version,size,mtime,ctime. ------- Graphics options ------- -i Don't print indentation lines. -A Print ANSI lines graphic indentation lines. -S Print with CP437 (console) graphics indentation lines. -n Turn colorization off always (-C overrides). -C Turn colorization on always. ------- XML/HTML/JSON options ------- -X Prints out an XML representation of the tree. -J Prints out an JSON representation of the tree. -H baseHREF Prints out HTML format with baseHREF as top directory. -T string Replace the default HTML title and H1 header with string. --nolinks Turn off hyperlinks in HTML output. ------- Input options ------- --fromfile Reads paths from files (.=stdin) ------- Miscellaneous options ------- --version Print version and exit. --help Print usage and this help message and exit. -- Options processing terminator. I will show some flags’ usage which I am using a lot. The options are very similar to the ls command.
-a, list all the files including the hidden files. In the CAD development, some files are for debugging purpose or for one-time configuration, and they are hidden. To list the hidden files, -a must be present.
-d, only list the folder, In some cases, the file list is huge but we only care about the folder structure. The folder will tell the clear structure
-L, controls the levels, sometimes, I don’t want to dive into all the folder levels and I only want to show 2 levels, then use -L 2.
-t, sort by last modified time. The flag is useful because when we want to see some new files generated recently, we can easily find them at the end of the tree view.
Another useful function is HTML or JSON output. In these days, HTML document is very popular and we can use tree to output the html code or json file to use them in our web applications.
Improvement or Exercises Please try below commands and see the output.
mkdir tree_demo cd tree_demo mkdir -p demo_1 demo_2 demo_3 demo_4 demo_5 touch demo_1/file_1 demo_2/file_2_1 demo_2/file_2_2 demo_3/file_3 demo_5/file_5 touch .demo_6 tree `pwd` tree `pwd` -a tree `pwd` -a --dirsfirst touch demo_2/file_2_2 tree `pwd` -a -t --dirsfirst tree `pwd` -a -t -L 1 --dirsfirst tree `pwd` -a -t -d -L 1 --dirsfirst

Case Study There is a cshell script file which is working in others’ environment but not in yours, one of prossibilities is that the cshell will load the unit cshell file ~/.cshrc( cshrc). So there might be some setting in others’ .cshrc files, but not in yours.
Understand In Unix-like system, when you want to get the help of one program from Command Line Interface (CLI), we can try the following ways, like csh.
man csh csh –help ➜ ~ csh --help tcsh 6.18.01 (Astron) 2012-02-14 (x86_64-apple-darwin) options wide,nls,dl,bye,al,kan,sm,rh,color,filec -b file	batch mode, read and execute commands from `file' -c command	run `command' from next argument -d	load directory stack from `~/.cshdirs' -Dname[=value]	define environment variable `name' to `value' (DomainOS only) -e	exit on any error -f	start faster by ignoring the start-up file -F	use fork() instead of vfork() when spawning (ConvexOS only) -i	interactive, even when input is not from a terminal -l	act as a login shell, must be the only option specified -m	load the start-up file, whether or not owned by effective user -n file	no execute mode, just check syntax of the following `file' -q	accept SIGQUIT for running under a debugger -s	read commands from standard input -t	read one line from standard input -v	echo commands after history substitution -V	like -v but including commands read from the start-up file -x	echo commands immediately before execution -X	like -x but including commands read from the start-up file --help	print this message and exit --version	print the version shell variable and exit See the tcsh(1) manual page for detailed information. If you are looking for parameter instead of argument, go to this page parameter.
Sometimes, we will see a cshell script which starts with /usr/bin/env csh -fx, this means using csh to execute, and when launching csh, ignore the start-up file (cshrc) and always print out the command before execution.
If cshell is not the default shell, launch the cshell by typing csh (in case cshell is not installed, we can install csh quit easily in most of platforms - google install csh).
If we want to write a Cabell executable file, here is the example:
#!/usr/bin/env tcsh echo "This is my first csh example" ; exit ; Save the content into a file named demo_001.csh.
Run the following commands:
chmod +x demo_001.csh ./demo_001.csh The first line of an executable file starting with #! is (on Linux) interpreted by the Linux kernel inside the implementation of execve system call (which is invoked, after fork, by the shell for most commands - those that are not functions and not shell builtins).
About “Hash-Bang” or “Shebang”, refer to this wiki page - SheBang (Unix).
Exercises Get the help of csh on your own machine. Check the version of csh. Write a csh program file and print out “Hello World”. Links Google Search: csh install Wiki Page: Shebang (Unix) Knowledge Link: cshrc

I have tried many different tools to organize the information collected online. The services like raindrop.io, App List, cubox, etc. They all have their own use cases and scenarios. And Cubox can support tags, date, sort, and other more functions. Comparing to these apps, Notion is a good replacement which can serve the collection very well.
Result This is the view for my current inbox (Table View). The links are added to the inbox by sharing function from my iPhone when I browse the technical articles or news. And they are also from my EDGE browser on MAC or PC. When I browse online for news or technical topic, or work related items, I will simply click share the link and put them to the Notion/Inbox.
The table in Notion is a type of database, so we can add any column we want. I added one checkbox column called “To Obsidian” (Check Notion and Obsidian), tags and create date. At the bottom, for each column, we can also define the summary for each column.
Switch to Gallery View
Understand Now let’s try to build the Inbox page in your Notion. In the Inbox or Collection, you can put anything you want, an article link, an apple store app link, a piece of idea, a text message, and so on. This is easy to be done by just click the share button on the smart phone. Since we are building a read later database, so we can put any property we want to each item. I have uninstalled several apps in my iPhone, what about you?
Create a new page Click the “+” button next to the WORKSPACE or PRIVATE. And then give the new page a name, for instance, “Inbox” or “Collection”.
Add “Table” database Create a table for the new page
Then you will get an empty page like this.
Customize Columns Now, we can define the columns in our collection table. I want to add 2 more columns, one is “To Obsidian” and another one is “Create Date”.
“To Obsidian” is a checkbox to tell which would be going to the Obsidian, transfer the knowing to knowledge.
“Create Date” is the date and time when each row is created. This will tell me when did I snap the article in.
Improve Now we have the table, by install the iOS or Android Notion app, click any share button and save the content to the Notion>Collection. All the Notion with the same account will update the table, and then start to do the close reading, transfer the knowledge, etc.
The table column also has sort and filter function. Please play around the followings:
Add a “Read” column. Once the article is read, mark it. Filter the column “Read”, only display “Unread” items. Sort by “Create Date” Try the summary of columns, show the count, date duration, etc. Add new property for the data item per the need and it will apply to all the items.

author: “Steve” title: “What is best for IPC or RPC? I tell, you choose” date: “2022-01-16” description: “The course actually help me to understand how to deal with communication with others.” tags : [ “PM”, “Learning” ] categories : [“THOUGHT”] First question I want to go throug is: What is IPC and RPC, and why it is important in Hardward design flow?
IPC or Inter-Process Communication which refers specifically to the mechanisms an operating system provides to allow the processes to manage shared data. RPC or Remote Procedure Call, which builds on some form of inter-process communication, provides a mechanism for calling a procedure in a program running on a remote system is called. Approaches There are several ways to achieve the goal. Share the data from one process to another process. This is very common, as you may know, digital ASIC design flow is splitted to several stages, floorplan, placement, cts, postcts, route, postroute, physical verification (drc/lvs) etc. Between each stage, we need to hand over the work from one to another.
Approach Description fork Programs create new process singal file message socket pipe memory fork A new process (external program, thread or just coroutine) could run from current running job. Either the function is done by another executable program or another programming language. Another case is that we may want to distribute the job to different hosts, and make full use of multiple threads.
signal file message socket pipe memory Metrics So for hardware design CAD framework, how could we choose? I just share the priority in my mind. You may have your priority in your organization. You may not need to find the most advanced technology, you should only need to figure out the best-fit solutions. This is the engineering mindset :)
Metric Priority Explanation customer high It is based on the knowledge of pruduct customers stability high Re-try or bad data is critical. adoption high It should be supported by different EDA tools, different program languages. portability medium Very good to have. dependency medium Make the dependency as “easy “as possible deployment medium It must be easy to deploy. spead low Real time and highly concurrent is not critical. So based on the table above, I vote the first 3 high priority. In the hardware design scenario, CAD framework is serving, helping a specific domain engnieers, they are good at hardware design, and hardware design has various background knowledge requirement. Some ASIC frontend engineers may like python, perl, and makefile, but some ASIC backend engineers may prefer tcl, perl, shell, or EDA tool specific language. Backend process relies on tool a lot nowadays.
Stability is anohter very important one, the cost of re-run is very high. For software, web service, maybe re-send a request will not affect any user experience and only takes one seconds to re-do something. But, in ASIC Backend flow, after routing is done, if you want to fix the floorplan issue, we may already waste a lot of engineering time, license spense, and pay the business loss of losing market time.
adoption is similar to stability, for ASIC flows, we rely on EDA tools a lot. If the tool can not support the methodology, technology we choose, then communicating with EDA tools will become very bad.
for others, they may good to have or just needed in some scenarios.
